meanings.definition: Phonologists: experts who study the sound systems of languages.
meanings.sent1: The phonologists conducted research on how different languages use sounds.
meanings.sent2: Many phonologists work in universities to understand how sounds are used in speech.
meanings.sent3: The phonologists had a 'sound-off' competition to see who could mimic the most accents.
meanings.sent4: In the world of linguistics, phonologists are like detectives decoding the mysteries of speech.
meanings.sent5: The group of phonologists listened intently to the recordings of various dialects.

meanings.definition: Phonologists: those who analyze and interpret speech sounds.
meanings.sent1: The phonologists carefully listened to the pronunciation of each word.
meanings.sent2: Some phonologists focus on specific accents to understand speech patterns.
meanings.sent3: During the party, the phonologists amused everyone by imitating famous speeches.
meanings.sent4: The phonologists' ears were like finely tuned instruments, capturing every nuance of speech.
meanings.sent5: The phonologists' work made the world of speech sound clearer and more fascinating.
